Other Information

Regional

Manufacturer

Boeing

The 737-100 is the first 737 plane to be produced. It was rolled out in 1965. And first f commercial flight in 1967. Only 38 were made, 22 going to Lufthansa, 7 for Singapore and 2 for Avianca. NASA did own a 737-100 for test purposes. But after, Boeing 737-100’s we’re given to smaller airlines. The 737-100 is overshadowed by the 737-200, which had a lot more airlines operating.

Trivia

  • The first prototype of the 737-100 was given to NASA, where it was used to make advancements in safety technology. Also happens to be the last -100 in service, retired in 2003.
  • Unlike its competitors at the time, the -100 has wing-mounted engines instead of rear-mounted ones.
